page.title: 18Interview-Macalpine Crescent
page.content: A friendly old man of about 75 was sitting in a red and yellow striped deckchair. He had a small semi-detached bungalow in Macalpine Crescent and it was about 26 years old. The roof had reddy-brown tiles and the house was built of brick. He had a small garden with gate and fence made of wood. His pet mongrel terrier was bouncing up and down the garden, trying to get out. He said he had five children, all married and gone away. All lived locally except one who lived in Cornwall. He wore a pair of old trousers that looked too big, a shirt and a yellow cardigan. He was mostly bald but the grey hair he did have was neatly combed back. His shoes were brown and shone as if he was expecting us!
